title: Product Developer Jewellery - H&M Womenswear
description:
**Job Description** *Are you passionate about fashion, driven by results, and excited about turning creative ideas into commercial success?*

*We are looking for a Product Developer with a strategic mindset, a passion for fashion, and a collaborative spirit to join our Accessories team at H&M Womenswear.*

*This is a full-time position at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden.*

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**  

In this role as a Product Developer, you will take strong ownership of bringing the H&M Women jewellery assortment to life. You will work hands‑on throughout the development process, identifying opportunities, shaping seasonal updates and turning trends and insights into well‑crafted, desirable products that resonate with our customers.


You’ll drive the work forward from idea to final product, ensuring smooth execution in a fast‑paced environment. This includes close collaboration with a product manager, planner and designer, as well as cross‑functional teams across the business. You will also partner directly with production teams and suppliers to secure quality, fit and timely delivery.


With your passion for jewellery and product development, you will play an essential role in creating the best products that are beautifully made, on trend and commercially strong.

  

**WHO YOU ARE**  

Qualifications:

* 5+ years of experience in a similar role as Product Developer within jewellery
* Education in Textiles, Buying or Product Development
* Proven track record in creating jewellery products for the womenswear customer with a strong sense of fashion and refined taste
* Excellent insight into current fashion trends and the ability to translate them into desirable and commercially relevant jewellery
* Deep passion for product and product development, with a strong interest in jewellery design and construction
* Extensive material knowledge, including metals, finishes, stones, resins and other jewellery-specific components
* Driven, structured and proactive in taking initiative
* Commercial mindset with a results-oriented approach
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
* Strong ability to identify opportunities, improvements and efficient solutions across the jewellery development process

 **WHO WE ARE**  

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.


We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

 **JOIN US**  

Additional information:  

**This is full-time position, with placement in Stockholm.** If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including **CV in English as soon as possible.** Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with you manager before applying.) If you are currently in a permanent employment with H&M you will keep your permanent employment even if you take on a temporary position for a limited time.


Benefits:  

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.

  

Inclusion & Diversity:  

H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.


We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: utvecklare
description:
**Är du en nyfiken utvecklare som vill vidareutveckla dina färdigheter i en solid professionell miljö?**
========================================================================================================

Ser du möjligheter där andra ser utmaningar?  

Vill du arbeta med framgångsrika företag och vidareutveckla deras affärskritiska system?


Vi har en stor efterfrågan ifrån våra kunder och vill därför stärka vårt utvecklarteam. Som utvecklare på Align Consulting kommer du att spela en central roll i utvecklingen och implementeringen av tekniska lösningar som optimerar applikationer och system för våra kunder. Dina uppgifter kommer att vara relaterade till att se de möjligheter som finns i utvecklingen av applikationer som effektiviserar våra kunders affärssystem, i nära samarbete med våra rådgivare. Som ERP-utvecklare kommer du att arbeta på både teknisk och strategisk nivå, vilket ställer stora krav på din yrkeskompetens. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas tillsammans med bra kollegor och spännande kunder. Du kommer att bidra till att forma strategiskt viktiga funktioner som kommer att ha stor inverkan på våra kunders fortsatta verksamhet. Vill du använda din tekniska stil för att vidareutveckla och forma affärskritiska system för Sverige och Norges främsta företag? Då är det dig vi letar efter.**Viktiga uppgifter kommer att vara:**
* Anpassning och integration
* Migrering av data mellan system och applikationer
* Analysera, upptäcka och utveckla system som underlättar vardagen för våra kunder
* Apputveckling
* Konfigurera och automatisera
* Utveckling av rapporter
* Utveckla optimeringsmoduler för att säkerställa effektiva processer
* Applikationsutveckling
* Felsökning och rapportering

  



Vi söker dig med en högre relevant utbildning, gärna inom informationsteknik eller motsvarande, gärna med kunskap om affärssystem som IFS, Infor, SAP eller Microsoft Dynamics. Du har bra teknisk stil, har du några års erfarenhet som konsult är det ett plus. Vi söker en vass hjärna som vill utvecklas hos oss, vi är därför öppna för såväl akademiker som mer seniora utvecklare. På Align arbetar vi med stora, internationella och välrenommerade företag som ställer höga krav på våra tjänster – vilket gör att vi också ställer höga krav på oss själva. Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du att arbeta både kod- och kundutbildad och vara en av företagets viktigaste utvecklare.



På Align Consulting blir du en del av ett gediget och ambitiöst företag där varje medarbetare bidrar till ständig tillväxt och kundnöjdhet. Din vardag kommer att präglas av generösa, inkluderande kollegor som skrattar högt och ofta. Om du ser dig själv som mer introvert har vi också fler som du, hos oss finns det plats för alla! På Align handlar det om helheten, där vi möter förslag och nya idéer med ett öppet sinne. Vi erbjuder ett jobb du kan växa i och vår ambition är att se till att du blir en drivande kraft som säkrar oss ett av de bästa utvecklarteamen i landet. Som företag präglas vi av vår professionalism, samtidigt som vi internt har en informell, inkluderande och stimulerande arbetsmiljö. Vi erbjuder konkurrensvillkor, med en gemensam bonusstruktur, samt bra pensions- och försäkringssystem.



Om du har några frågor eller önskar att veta mera, ta kontakt med Fredrik Aldén, rekryteringsansvarig i Align Consulting.
Fredrik Aldén

title: ServiceNow-utvecklare
description:
Vill du arbeta verksamhetsnära med en av världens ledande plattformar för digitala arbetsflöden? Har du erfarenhet av ServiceNow och brinner för att skapa smarta, effektiva och användarvänliga lösningar? Då kan detta vara din nästa utmaning hos vår kund inom försvarsindustrin.
  
Vi söker nu en erfaren ServiceNow Business Analyst/Utvecklare med kompetens inom Customer Service Management (CSM) som vill vara med och vidareutveckla en plattform som används av tusentals medarbetare.
  
  

RollenI den här rollen arbetar du i gränslandet mellan verksamhet och teknik. Du är med och driver utvecklingen framåt – från behov och krav till färdig lösning.
  
  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:**  

Arbeta nära verksamheten och våra kravställare för att förstå behov och omsätta dem i hållbara lösningar
  
  

Utveckla, konfigurera och förvalta CSM-modulen i ServiceNow
  
  

Skapa effektiva, värdeskapande och användarvänliga processer och interaktioner
  
  

Automatisera flöden och förbättra arbetssätt genom smart plattformsutnyttjande
  
  

Vi söker dig somDu är analytisk, nyfiken och har ett genuint teknikintresse. Du trivs med att arbeta både på detaljnivå och med helhetsarkitektur, och du motiveras av att skapa lösningar som gör verklig skillnad i verksamheten.
  
  

**Vi ser att du har:**  

Relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
  
  

Gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling i ServiceNow, särskilt inom CSM
  
  

Goda kunskaper i JavaScript
  
  

Erfarenhet av att utveckla och automatisera processer och flöden i ServiceNow
  
  

Förmåga att leda workshops och föra dialog med verksamhet eller kund
  
  

Erfarenhet av förvaltning, felsökning och incidenthantering
  
  

Förståelse för arkitektur och hur lösningar passar in i en större systemmiljö
  
  

Som person är du en naturlig problemlösare som trivs i en agil miljö. Du tar initiativ, samarbetar gärna och delar med dig av din kunskap. Du söker ständigt nya utmaningar och drivs av att skapa verkligt värde.
  
  

Om Akkodis
  
  

Akkodis levererar en bred bas av tjänster och kompetenser inom IT och Engineering. Våra tjänster präglas av snabbhet, enkelhet och kvalitet.
  
  

På Akkodis tror vi att man måste gå bortom det möjliga för att göra det otroliga. När det gäller en karriär på Akkodis, är det du som sitter i förarsätet. Vi är stolta över en kultur av förtroende där du har befogenhet att fatta dina egna beslut och får det stöd du behöver för att nå dina ambitioner. Som konsult är du vår högsta prioritet och när du behöver oss, finns vi där för dig.
  
  

Genom att bli vår kollega kommer din vardag som konsult vara varierad med uppdrag i olika projekt i diverse branscher, system och miljöer. Din erfarenhetsbank kommer att växa liksom ditt sociala och professionella kontaktnät. Som konsult omfattas du av kollektivavtal, försäkringar, företagshälsovård, friskvårdsbidrag och rabatter på träningskort. För att vi ska lära av varandra ordnar vi regelbundet med sociala aktiviteter.
  
  

Vi är ett mångsidigt team av 50,000 ingenjörer och digitala experter, verksamma i 30 länder och ser fram emot att ansluta dig till vår skara.
  
  

Låter detta intressant? Sök då in till oss så snart som möjligt! Våra uppdrag kommer in löpande och därför ses vi gärna proaktivt.
  
  

Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta ansvarig konsultchef Alisha Milikic på alisha.milikic@akkodisgroup.com
company_description: Akkodis is a global digital engineering consulting company combining technology and talent to accelerate transformation, drive innovation, and shape an intelligent, more sustainable future.

title: Systemutvecklare mjukvarusystem Telekrigstödenheten 2026
description:
**Systemutvecklare mjukvarusystem vid Telekrigstödenheten**

**Telekrigstödenheten (TKSE/Stockholm) är Försvarsmaktens kompetenscentrum inom sensor- och motmedelssystem. TKSE har till uppgift att dataförsörja och analysera information från varnar- och motmedelssystem på Försvarsmaktens kvalificerade plattformar. TKSE är en försvarsmaktsgemensam resurs för dataförsörjning av signalkrigplattformar inom alla arenor. Signalkrigföring är centralt för verkan och skydd på det moderna slagfältet.**

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**


Vidmakthålla, integrera och utveckla mjukvarulösningar för olika sensorsystem inom radar, IR, hydroakustik och samband på TKSE. Arbetsuppgiften innbär även att omsätta tekniska och operativa krav till fungerande lösningar i komplexa, säkerhetsklassade miljöer i nära samband med systemingenjörer och analytiker.


Du kommer att arbeta med systemutveckling, dokumentation, driftsättning och testning av programvaror för rekonstruktion och produktion.


Försvarsmakten/TKSE är starkt tillväxt och arbetsuppgifterna kan komma att förändras över tid.


**KRAV**


* Högskoleutbildning inom data- systemvetenskap eller som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig.
* Dokumenterad flerårig erfarenhet av systemutveckling i Java och Java Enterprise System (JavaEE).
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i agila utvecklingsprojekt med testdriven design.
* God förmåga att utrrycka dig själv i tal och text på svenska och engelska.


**Personliga egenskaper**


För att lyckas i rollen som systemutvecklare mjukvarusystem på Telekrigstödenheten krävs egenskaper som samarbetsförmåga, att du är lösningsorienterad, strukturerad, stabil och trygg samt målmedveten.


Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.


**MERITERANDE**


* Erfarenhet av arbete med relationsdatabaser och användargränssnittsutveckling (RCP/Swing/GWT och Web-ramverk)
* Erfarenhet av arbete med HADOOP – teknik
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av konfigurations- och releasehantering i Java-miljö (såsom Maven, Ant, subversion, Jira)
* Javacertifierad av Oracle/Sun.
* Erfarenhet av programspråket Python.
* Erfarenhet av IT-säkerhet.
* Erfarenhet av NOSQL-databaser.
* Erfarenhet av olika kartmotorer, GIS-system och format.
* Erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling mot telekrigssystem och/eller telekrigsdata.


*För att myndighetens uppdrag ska vara framgångsrikt förutsätts att alla medarbetare uppträder enligt den värdegrund som finns. Försvarsmaktens värdegrund slår vakt om alla människors lika värde, rättvisa och jämlikhet och främjar demokrati och mänskliga rättigheter (läs mer på* *www.forsvarsmakten.se**).*


**Övrigt**  

Civil befattning  

Anställningsform: Tillsvidare, Försvarsmakten tillämpar sex månaders provanställning för dig som inte är anställd i myndigheten. Inget distansarbete kan erbjudas.
  

Sysselsättningsgrad: Heltid  

Arbetsort: Stockholm. Både in- och utrikesresor förekommer.
  

Arbetstid: Grundarbetstid är mån-fre 0730-1630, med möjlighet till flex. Periodvis (exempelvis under övningar eller resor) sker arbete även på kvällar och helger, som genererar extra ledighet och/eller lönetillägg i enlighet med gällande arbetstidsavtal.  

Tillträdesdatum: Snarast eller efter överenskommelse.


**Upplysningar om befattningen**  

Rekryterande chef, Daniel Söderman, nås via växeln på 0171-157000.


**Information om rekryteringsprocessen**  

Hedda Hessel, nås via växeln på 0171-157000.


Fördjupad säkerhets- och lämplighetsprövning kommer att genomföras med slutkandidater.


**Fackliga företrädare**

  

SACO: Carl-Johan Pettersson


SEKO: Ulrica Lundh


OFR/S - Clarence Arnstedt


OFR/O, OF Enköping - Mikael Eriksson


Samtliga nås via växeln på 0171-157000.


**Ansökan**


**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2026-03-31. Din ansökan bör innehålla CV samt ansökningsbrev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning.**

title: SharePoint Developer
description:
*We are looking for a SharePoint Developer who enjoys building practical, user-friendly business solutions. You will work with SharePoint, Microsoft 365, Azure, and collaboration tools to improve productivity and support our technology strategy. If you like solving problems, collaborating in teams, and helping users get the most from digital platforms, this role is for you.*  


*It all starts with people. People like you.*  


**Join our team**

Epiroc IT Collaboration Solutions provides reliable and innovative tools for information sharing, communication, and collaboration. Through unified communications, low-code platforms, automation, and training, we empower our colleagues to work efficiently and securely — independently, in teams, and with partners and customers. Our goal is to enable seamless collaboration through advanced technology, well-defined services, and transparent processes.  


**Your mission**

As a SharePoint Developer, you will work with the SharePoint Lead Developer, Architect, Support Lead, project managers, and operations team to design, develop, and maintain SharePoint solutions. You will also support daily activities by investigating and resolving user requests, incidents, and change requests.  



Your focus will be to build solutions that follow coding standards, fit within the overall SharePoint architecture, and meet business needs. Collaboration is key—you will work with different teams to make platforms easier to use, increase productivity, and encourage adoption. You will also follow Microsoft and company best practices for security, architecture, and compliance to ensure a stable and future-ready platform.  


**Key responsibilities**
* Plan, develop, and maintain SharePoint solutions according to business needs and coding standards.
* Document solutions and suggest ways to improve processes.
* Participate in meetings and collaborate with colleagues, business teams, and other IT functions.
* Ensure security, architecture, and design principles are followed.
* Translate technical requirements into practical and maintainable solutions.
* Support proactive platform management, security, and daily business support.

  


**Your profile**We are looking for someone who can balance multiple tasks, work with attention to detail, and think analytically. You should enjoy solving problems, sharing knowledge, and creating reusable solutions for the team.  


**You should also have**:
* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, or equivalent experience.
* 2+ years of experience developing and maintaining enterprise SharePoint solutions.
* Proficiency in SharePoint Framework (SPFx), REST/Graph APIs, and Azure Logic Apps.
* Experience integrating SharePoint with Microsoft Teams, Azure Functions, or other Microsoft 365 services.
* Understanding of Classic vs. Modern SharePoint differences.
* Knowledge of information architecture, including site structure, content types, metadata, and navigation best practices.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines, Git, or Azure DevOps for development and deployment workflows.
* Familiarity with Agile methods such as Scrum, DevOps, and tools like Azure Boards.

  


**Location and other**

This position can be in Örebro, Stockholm, or Prague.  


We can offer a hybrid workplace—a way of working that provides flexibility and promotes a healthier balance between professional and personal life.  


**Why Epiroc?**

By joining our team, you’ll make a big difference in the energy transition. At Epiroc, we take pride in being passionate innovators, driving the change toward a brighter future for both people and the planet. Guided by our values of Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation, we foster a culture of trust, growth, and lasting impact.  



To support your journey, we offer a competitive Total Rewards Package, including:
* Global career opportunities
* Learning & Development programs
* Benefits package, including variable compensation (bonus)
* Flexible work culture promoting balance and well-being
* Global Parental Leave Policy
* Community involvement

  


**Application and contact information**

We encourage you to submit your application through our online career site as soon as possible, but no later than **March 9th.**  



We are committed to a thorough recruitment process, including interviews, reference checks and assessments. To ensure a safe working environment, we conduct identity checks and drug and alcohol screening. Our process is designed to be fair and inclusive; you can expect transparent communication and a balanced evaluation of your skills and experience.  



For questions about the position, please contact:

Hans Kästel Hård, Manager IT Collaboration Solutions, hans.hard@epiroc.com
Ellinor Ekelöf, Recruitment specialist, ellinor.ekelof@epiroc.com  

**It all starts with people.** The world needs metals and minerals for the energy transition and our cities and infrastructure must be developed to serve a growing population. To succeed, we need to speed up the shift towards more sustainable mining and construction industries. We at Epiroc accelerate this transformation, together with customers and business partners in more than 150 countries, by developing and providing innovative and safe equipment, digital solutions, and aftermarket support.
All new thinkers are welcome. We are looking for those who want to develop, grow, and dare to think new. In Epiroc we attract, develop, and retain diverse talent valuing authenticity and unique perspectives, driving our spirit of innovation. We foster an inclusive culture where diversity isn't just a goal but a part of our values and way of working. This is how we do business for a sustainable future. Learn more at www.epiroc.com

title: Software Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Role:**
 The Software Engineer would be working on a in-house application being developed that enables business users to plan product presentation for their consumers.
   

  

**Essential requirements:**
* Proficient in React with working knowledge in Node.js. Should be understand concepts of both FE and BE.
* Ability to take initiative and responsibility for decisions that influence the success of team objectives (or any other relevant objectives).
* Effectively applies methodical approach to problem definition, investigation and resolution.
* Required cloud certification: Azure


**Last day to apply** 
 : 23-02-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Frontend Developer to Nordea Life & Pension Sweden
description:
**Job ID: 3057**
 Nordea Life & Pension Sweden is a subsidiary of Nordea Bank with its own internal IT organization. We are working closely with our business colleagues as we are responsible for developing modern services and platforms for our external and internal customers.
   

  

 We are looking for a Frontend Software Developer to help us digitalize the insurance market.
   

  

 We know that our customers' needs are changing, and we have a strong focus on matching them with the pension solutions of the future. We collaborate in finding opportunities and nurture a place of growth, so come up with your ideas, skills, and experiences, and let's make a difference together. Our unit Node IT currently works with some of Sweden's leading employers, including tech, IT-consultants and law firms.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Our team’s mission is to help employers and their employees towards a better and safer life. We offer you an exciting workplace with the opportunity to work on a modern technology stack (GraphQL, Node.js, GitHub, Google Cloud Platform, React.js, vitest, nx) developing the premier benefit brokerage platform in Sweden. Our tech and product team consists of around 20 highly motivated colleagues. We welcome new ideas and technological solutions.
   

  

 As the Frontend Developer, you will be part of an agile team responsible for writing and maintaining several services in our microservice architecture.
   

  

**What you will be doing:**
* Develop new features in close collaboration with backend teams, product managers, business users and other stakeholders
* Write a modern web application with the highest accessibility standards using modern tools and frameworks
* Deliver a great user experience in the complex domain of insurances and other entitelments


 At Node IT you get to work in a dynamic start-up-like environment, whilst having access to the great benefit package offered by Nordea Group and Nordea Life & Pensions Sweden.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 As the Frontend Developer, we expect that you have a great interest in the business to deliver concrete business value for our users.
   

  

**This is the right role for you if you:**
* Have a customer centric mindset and you seek actively value-creation opportunities through technology enablers
* Can collaborate with different stakeholders such as business and IT units across the value chain
* Like to develop yourself and learn new skills; being on top of new tech stuff


**Your experience and background:**
* Experience with modern web development, specifically React.js and React Router v7
* Fluent English skills
* Swedish language skills (fluency B1-B2 in reading and listening, at least A2 in writing and talking)


**It is beneficial if you also know/have:**
* Experience interacting with GraphQL apis
* Experience from the insurance industry
* Skilled at aligning diverse viewpoints and turning shared goals into concrete actions
* Experience with other modern frontend frameworks like Svelte, HTMX, Vue or Angular


 This role is open in Stockholm or Malmö. We follow hybrid model of working.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 10/03/2026. For more information on the position, you are welcome to contact Simon Carmelid, simon.carmelid@nordea.com . Please note that we will proceed with potential candidates already during the application period.
   

  

 Shortlisted candidates may have an introductory call with the hiring leader. We might include a technical home assignment in the recruitment process. If you have any questions about recruitment steps you may contact our recruiter Sanna Frisk at  sanna.frisk@nordea.com .
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on the broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
**Senior Full-Stack Developer (.NET) - Travel Industry - Stockholm (Hybrid)** 




  





 A leading Scandinavian travel and leisure company is looking for a Senior Full-Stack Developer to join their growing digital team in Stockholm.
 



  





 This is a chance to work with a well-established, highly recognisable brand that’s investing heavily in modernising its digital platforms and building new, cloud-native solutions that directly enhance the customer experience across web and mobile.
 



  





 You’ll be part of a small, cross-functional team that takes full ownership of its products - working end-to-end on architecture, development, CI/CD, and scaling in Azure. You’ll have the trust and autonomy to influence technical direction, make key decisions, and bring forward new ideas that shape the digital journey for millions of users.
 



  





**Tech stack:** 



* .NET Core, C#, Azure
* React (or similar modern JS frameworks)
* CI/CD, cloud architecture, API development



  





**Requirements:** 



* 5+ years’ experience in .NET / C#, Azure, SQL, and React/TypeScript
* Strong understanding of architecture, microservices, and event-driven systems
* DevOps mindset and experience with CI/CD, IaC, and Azure Cloud
* Bachelor's or Master’s degree; Fluent in Swedish



  





**What’s on offer:** 



* Hybrid work setup in central Stockholm
* Opportunity to work on large-scale, customer-facing products with modern tech
* Flat, collaborative environment where your input truly matters
* Long-term stability combined with a forward-looking, innovative culture



  





 If you’re a hands-on developer who enjoys solving complex problems, collaborating closely with product teams, and taking ownership of technical direction, this could be a great fit.
 



  





 Apply or reach out directly for a confidential chat.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - Lylli
description:
At Lylli, we’re on a mission to make reading magical for children everywhere. Our app combines thousands of children’s books with personalized stories, helping families discover new ways to read, learn, and imagine together.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a Senior Fullstack Developer to help us scale our platform, build delightful new features, and bring the joy of reading to millions of families worldwide.
   

  

 We're a sister studio to Toca Boca, located in Östermalm.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Lead the development of end-to-end features, from database design and APIs to frontend interfaces.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other engineers to turn ideas into reality.
* Build scalable backend services (Java Spring Boot, Node.js) and polished frontend experiences (React).
* Ensure performance, security, and reliability across the stack as we scale internationally.
* Play an active role in architectural decisions and product strategy.


 ,
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience as a fullstack engineer, with strong skills in both backend and frontend.
* Solid knowledge of Java and/or Node.js and preferably React.
* Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure), CI/CD pipelines, and scalable system design.
* Strong understanding of relational databases and APIs (Postgres).
* A product-driven mindset – you care about usability, performance, and making the experience magical for the end user.
* Bonus: Experience with mobile development, audio streaming, or content-heavy platforms.


**Who You Are**
* You enjoy taking ownership and thrive in a fast-moving startup environment.
* You’re passionate about clean, maintainable code and engineering excellence.
* You love collaborating across functions and helping teammates grow.
* Most importantly: You want to use your skills to get more kids to love reading.


**What We Offer**
* A central role in shaping one of Europe’s fastest-growing children’s reading platforms.
* The opportunity to influence both product and technical direction.
* A playful, collaborative, and international team.


**Good to know!**
 This position is full time and based in our Stockholm office with a hybrid working model (part office, part working from home). We apply a 6-month probationary period. You’ll need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support relocation.
   

  

 Lylli is a Swedish tech company building the world’s first storytelling platform — reinventing how children experience stories in a digital world. By merging cutting-edge technology with captivating narratives, Lylli transforms reading into an immersive, joyful experience that fosters cognitive growth and inspires a lifelong love of books. In partnership with leading publishers, authors, and creators, Lylli unlocks unlimited access to thousands of titles — from timeless classics like
 *Alfie Atkins* 
 and
 *Peter-No-Tail* 
 to global sensations like
 *Paw Patrol.*

title: Solution Developer SEB Capture | SEB, Solna
description:
We’re looking for a Solution Developer to strengthen our agile DevOps team in Stockholm.
   

  

 Our current stack includes Tungsten Automation’s Capture suite for digital transformation of analog data captured from various sources such as PDF files and images. The analyzed data from scanned documents are refined and then made available for the users. We are actively exploring new, cloud-based solutions and AI capabilities to define the next steps in our digital journey.
   

  

 SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a developer in our team, you’ll be involved in:
   

  

* Coding, configuration, and implementing solutions using various languages and frameworks.
* Analysing requirements and troubleshooting complex issues.
* Supporting users and ensuring smooth operations.


 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

**Core Competences**
* Coding in C#.
* Database knowledge (SQL).
* Advanced troubleshooting skills.
* Windows server operations basics.
* Technical incident management fundamentals.
* Agile development experience.


**Bonus Skills**
* Hands-on experience with Tungsten Automation TotalAgility.
* Familiarity with intelligent Capture systems, integrating Google Cloud native technologies and AI capabilities.
* Coding in Python.
* Coding in Powershell.
* General understanding of Lean Agile Framework (LeAF).


 What we offer
   

  

 We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience.
   

  

 The elements that define the core of our offering are:
   

  

* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Hybrid Workplace.
* Innovative company in forefront of technology.
* Opportunities to help transform an industry.
* Mobility within a large global company.
* Agile and modern ways of working.
* Empowering environment.
* Deliver world-class service to customers.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 16 of February 2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Anita Sehat at anita.sehat@seb.se.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. title: Senior Backend Engineer (Python/Go) - Consumer Platform team
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**Are you excited about building the systems that keep Wolt running for millions of customers every day?** 
 We’re looking for a pragmatic
 **Backend Developer** 
 with strong skills in
 **Python or Go** 
 to join our
 **Consumer Platform** 
**team** 
 –the crew behind the core consumer infrastructure and reliability efforts that make Wolt fast, stable, and scalable.
   

  

 The
 **Consumer Platform team** 
 plays a central role within Wolt’s engineering organization. We design and maintain the backend components that power Wolt’s consumer-facing experience–from critical purchase flows to the underlying systems that ensure reliability at scale. The team combines hands-on software development with elements of DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), continuously improving how our systems perform and how our teams deliver.
   

  

 Known across Wolt for driving cross-team technical initiatives, the team works on challenges that impact the entire platform. Recent projects include scaling our purchase core to support split payments, developing an API gateway for Wolt’s most critical flows, and partnering with other teams to raise reliability standards company-wide.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Our team is primarily based in
 **Germany** 
**.**
**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Build and maintain high-throughput critical backend services in Python and Go
* Work across the complete development lifecycle—from architecture and design to deployment and monitoring
* Drive cross-team reliability initiatives and improve the scalability of Wolt’s platform
* Design and implement core services, shared libraries, internal tooling, and platform-level improvements that empower other teams and support our global consumer economy
* Define reliability best practices that make Wolt’s systems more robust


**Our Tech Stack:** 
 Python, Go, MongoDB, Redis, Datadog, CI/CD pipelines, Kubernetes, AWS.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 We’re looking for someone with:
   

  

* Solid experience in backend development using Python, Go, or similar languages.
* A passion for core engineering problems like system design, optimization, and scalability.
* Experience working on high-traffic, production systems.
* (Bonus) Familiarity with reliability engineering or on-call practices.
* Strong ownership mindset and curiosity — someone who likes to understand how things work under the hood.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate across teams
* A pragmatic, product-oriented mindset focused on solving real user problems


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Embedded Developer (f/m/x)
description:
At Sii Sweden we partner with some of the most forward-thinking companies across industries such as automotive, healthcare, life-science and banking.
 



 As an Embedded Software Developer at Sii, you won’t just write code—you’ll contribute to the success of diverse, high-impact projects that demand both deep technical knowledge and creative problem-solving; you’ll play a key role in delivering tailored solutions that meet client’s unique requirements.
 



 Joining us means working in a collaborative, consultancy-driven environment so If you're excited by challenge and the opportunity to grow alongside some of the best engineers in the field, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**Your tasks** 



* Design and implement software architecture for embedded systems
* Develop robust applications using C++ and Qt/QML for device interfaces and control logic
* Work on hardware-related programming, including device drivers
* Design, build, and debug embedded Linux environments (GNU/Linux) for various hardware platforms
* Write scripts and tools in Python (or equivalent) to support development, testing, and automation
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, QA, and UX designers
* Contribute to design reviews, documentation, and system integration activities



  





**Requirements** 



* Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar
* Solid experience with C++ in embedded system environments
* Strong knowledge of Qt/QML for UI and application layer development
* Experience with GNU/Linux system development and configuration
* Hands-on knowledge of hardware-level programming
* Familiarity with scripting in Python or a similar language
* Proficiency in embedded systems architecture and real-time constraints
* Ability to debug complex software/hardware interactions

title: Embedded-utvecklare (f/m/x)
description:
På Sii Sweden samarbetar vi med några av de mest framåtblickande företagen inom branscher som fordonsindustri, sjukvård, life-science och bank.
 



 Som Embedded Software Developer på Sii kommer du inte bara att skriva kod - du kommer att bidra till framgången för olika projekt med stor inverkan som kräver både djup teknisk kunskap och kreativ problemlösning; du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att leverera skräddarsydda lösningar som uppfyller kundens unika krav.
 



 Att börja hos oss innebär att arbeta i en samarbetsinriktad och konsultdriven miljö, så om du gillar utmaningar och möjligheten att växa tillsammans med några av de bästa ingenjörerna på området vill vi gärna höra från dig!
 



  





**Dina uppgifter** 



* Designa och implementera mjukvaruarkitektur för inbyggda system
* Utveckla robusta applikationer med hjälp av C++ och Qt/QML för enhetsgränssnitt och styrlogik
* Arbeta med hårdvarurelaterad programmering, inklusive enhetsdrivrutiner
* Designa, bygga och felsöka inbyggda Linux-miljöer (GNU/Linux) för olika hårdvaruplattformar
* Skriva skript och verktyg i Python (eller motsvarande) för att stödja utveckling, testning och automatisering
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team, inklusive hårdvaruingenjörer, QA och UX-designers
* Bidra till designgranskningar, dokumentation och systemintegrationsaktiviteter



  





**Krav** 



* Examen i programvaruteknik, datavetenskap eller liknande
* Gedigen erfarenhet av C++ i miljöer med inbyggda system
* Goda kunskaper i Qt/QML för utveckling av användargränssnitt och applikationslager
* Erfarenhet av utveckling och konfiguration av GNU/Linux-system
* Praktisk kunskap om programmering på hårdvarunivå
* Kännedom om skript i Python eller ett liknande språk
* Kunskaper om arkitektur för inbyggda system och realtidsbegränsningar
* Förmåga att felsöka komplexa interaktioner mellan programvara och hårdvara

title: IAM / Omada Identity Developer & Configuration Specialist - Stockholm
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specialising in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are seeking an experienced IAM / Omada Identity Developer & Configuration Specialist to implement, configure, and maintain robust IAM solutions. This hands-on role focuses on Omada Identity modules, connector development, workflows, and lifecycle automation. You will work closely with architects and operations teams to deliver stable, production-ready IAM configurations, support enhancements, and troubleshoot issues.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Configure and enhance Omada Identity modules, including roles, policies, workflows, and lifecycle management
* Develop, implement, and maintain connectors for AD / Entra ID and enterprise applications
* Support provisioning, synchronisation, and reconciliation jobs, including development and testing
* Design and implement request/approval workflows, forms, attribute mappings, and recertification logic
* Troubleshoot operational issues such as job failures, queue errors, and provisioning problems
* Maintain configuration documentation and ensure smooth handover to operations
* Execute changes in accordance with ITSM processes, including change, release, and test artefacts


**Requirements:**
* Hands-on experience with Omada Identity implementation and configuration
* Connector development experience for AD / Entra ID, APIs, and SQL-based systems
* Strong skills in configuring workflows, forms, and policies (requests, approvals, recertification)
* Solid understanding of provisioning concepts, identity lifecycle, and SoD basics
* Troubleshooting experience with logs, job failures, and synchronisation issues
* Basic MS SQL Server skills in an Omada context (queries, views, performance awareness)
* Strong documentation skills and structured delivery approach
* Fluent in English
* Preferred Qualifications:
+ Experience with REST or PowerShell for custom connector development
+ Familiarity with Azure services (Entra ID, Key Vault)
+ IAM test automation experience
+ Relevant certifications (e.g., ITIL® 4 Foundation)
+ Swedish language skills


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace, driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: CRM Solutions Development Consultant
description:
**Summary**
 At Avanade, we see how the power of Dynamics 365 shapes the future of businesses every day. By combining our unmatched Microsoft knowledge with our creative approach to innovation and strong industry knowledge, we create a lot of opportunities for Microsoft, our clients, and for you. Avanade has countless paths for you to pursue. One of them is sure to lead to your unique version of success.
   

  

 As a D365 Customer Engagement (CE) Developer, you’ll be considered a learned professional that applies your subject matter expertise to design and implement CRM solutions for our clients across all phases of Avanade’s projects. You’ll solve problems using CRM solutions as you liaise between Avanade clients and project teams made up of Project Managers, Functional Consultants, Back-End and Front-End (UX) Architects, and other CE professionals. This role provides the opportunity to work for Microsoft’s #1 partner with an unrivalled focus on personal development and training in both technology and softer consulting skills.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Consult and advise our clients and internal stakeholders on uses of technology to solve business problems
* Perform application development, complex code development, application testing, and component design
* Write technical specifications and collaborate with the functional team to ensure requirements are understood and aligned with the business needs
* Prototype, configure, and test respective business processes
* Enable the design of conceptual architecture and technical solutions
* Use key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and test the quality of projects
* Improve your clients’ business by identifying potential challenges and supporting continuous improvement through their CRM system
* Ensure that the Avanade guidelines for development and performance are fulfilled during the overall process of the project
* Utilize Avanade assets for making development process faster and more efficient
* Collaborate with stakeholders to identify opportunities for AI-driven automation and implement Copilot Studio features for improved customer engagement.


**Qualifications**
**Skills and experiences**
* At least one full-cycle implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE or Dynamics CRM
* Experience analyzing, designing, developing, customizing & configuring, implementing and maintaining Microsoft Dynamics CRM and Power Platform application code for Sales and Customer Service functionality
* Used Software-as-a Service (SaaS) environments, Microsoft SQL Server, HTML, Javascript, Microsoft ASP, Microsoft .NET, and Azure DevOps
* Integrate and customize workflows using Copilot Studio to build conversational AI experiences and automate business processes.
* Client management skills and the ability to work with customers to develop and manage an action plan
* Collaborated with global teams on CE technology implementation and maintenance projects
* Strong consulting skills and client-facing experience with an implementation partner and/or end user
* Bachelor’s degree, or its foreign equivalent, in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems, or equivalent relevant work experience.


 Characteristics that can spell success for this role
   

  

* Analytical, curious, agile
* Team player and good communicator
* Problem-solver, patient, quality-driven
* Self-motivating
* Innovative mindset
