title: Cloud Consultant
description:
Vi söker en erfaren M365-konsult för ett konsultuppdrag hos kund. Uppdraget är placerat på kundens IT-avdelning och har fokus på förvaltning och tjänsteägarskap snarare än utveckling och projekt. Du kommer att arbeta i en central och verksamhetsnära roll med helhetsansvar för Microsoft 365-plattformen.
 



  





**Ansvarsområden** 




  




* Tjänsteägarskap för Microsoft 365
* Förvaltning och vidareutveckling av M365-plattformen
* Ansvar för Exchange och mailflöden
* Arbete med Purview, Power Automate samt säkerhetsrelaterade funktioner
* Hantering av frågor inom compliance och governance
* Rådgivning och stöd till IT-avdelning och verksamhet
* Bidra till struktur, styrning och utveckling av arbetssätt kopplat till plattformen



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




  




* Bred och dokumenterad erfarenhet av Microsoft 365
* Erfarenhet av tjänsteägarskap eller förvaltningsansvar
* God kunskap inom Exchange, mailflöden och M365-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av arbete med compliance och governance inom M365
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och ta helhetsansvar
* Strukturerad, kommunikativ och trygg i en bred specialistroll
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





**Meriterande** 




  




* Erfarenhet av arbete i större organisationer med komplex IT-miljö
* Certifieringar inom Microsoft 365
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning eller förbättringsarbete inom IT-förvaltning



  





**Annat** 




  





 Vissa av våra kunder kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vår tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. Vissa tjänster kan även kräva viss typ av medborgarskap.
 



  





**Om Astek Sweden** 




  





 Astek har alltid drivits av en stark upptäckarlust och en passion för teknikens möjligheter. Denna fascination utgör grunden för allt vi gör – vårt engagemang för innovation och produktutveckling, de långvariga kundrelationer vi bygger samt det värde vi skapar i varje uppdrag, varje dag. Hos oss får du möjligheten att utvecklas tillsammans med några av branschens mest kompetenta ingenjörer och tekniska experter.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




  





 Vi är ett företag där innovation, gemenskap och utveckling står i centrum. Hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta med spännande och utmanande projekt i en arbetsmiljö där din kompetens och dina idéer värdesätts. Vi erbjuder:
 



  




* En inspirerande arbetsplats där teknik och kreativitet möts.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med ledande aktörer inom branschen.
* Kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter.
* En företagskultur där vi har kul tillsammans och stöttar varandra!
* Bra förmåner som t.ex. 5000 kr i friskvård.



  





 Vi uppmuntrar alla ingenjörer och specialister att söka oavsett kön, bakgrund eller livssituation.
 



  





**Vill du också vara en del av vårt team?** 




  





 Då är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan.
 



  





 Vi rekryterar löpande, tveka inte med din ansökan och kontakta oss gärna om du har frågor.

title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
description:
**About 360Player**
 360Player is building the operating system for sports organizations globally.
   

  

 We work with leading brands across multiple sports and countries — including FC Barcelona and Rafa Nadal Academy — while also powering one of the largest club networks in the U.S. market. We have local teams operating in Sweden, Spain, the UK, North America, and Australia, serving organizations at both elite and grassroots levels.
   

  

 Our platform supports sports organizations end-to-end: administration, payments, communication, athlete development, scheduling, registrations, and multi-sport operations — all within a unified, multi-tenant SaaS architecture.
   

  

 We have built one of the most comprehensive and advanced platforms in the market for managing complex administrative processes, particularly within scheduling, registrations, and payments. Our customers rely on us to handle operational complexity at scale — across countries, sports, and customer segments.
   

  

 AI is becoming a core layer of our product. We are implementing AI broadly across features, workflows, automation, and reporting to improve decision-making, reduce manual work, and unlock new product capabilities.
   

  

 We serve 900,000+ users across 60+ countries. With ~75 employees and significant investment into U.S. expansion, we operate at meaningful global scale with strong product-market fit and clear category ambition.
   

  

 Headquartered in central Stockholm and well-funded, we are entering a phase where architecture, leadership, and execution will define our long-term position as the global leader in sports tech.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 We are hiring a CTO to lead our engineering organization through its next phase of scale.
   

  

 This is a leadership role first. You will lead and develop a team of 13 engineers and be responsible for performance, hiring, structure, and technical direction.
   

  

 You will work closely with the CEO and CPO. Product owns the roadmap — your responsibility is to ensure we build it in a scalable, secure, and future-proof way.
   

  

 What You Will Own
   

  

 Engineering Leadership
   

  

* Lead and develop a team of 13 engineers
* Build a culture of ownership, accountability, and high standards
* Establish scalable, AI-driven, engineering processes and operating principles
* Recruit, retain, and develop strong technical talent
* Lead performance and compensation reviews within engineering


 Technical Direction
   

  

 Our stack includes:
   

  

* TypeScript / React (frontend)
* Go (API/backend)
* MS SQL
* Azure (cloud infrastructure)
* AI-assisted development environments (e.g. Claude, Copilot-style workflows)


 You will:
   

  

* Own architecture and long-term technical direction
* Ensure scalability, security, and reliability of the platform
* Guide multi-tenant SaaS design and framework decisions
* Oversee infrastructure, DevOps, CI/CD, and observability
* Manage technical debt pragmatically while maintaining delivery velocity


 Product Enablement
   

  

* Partner with Product to scope solutions and evaluate feasibility
* Enable sustainable, efficient execution of the roadmap
* Drive clear build-vs-buy and integration decisions


 External Representation
   

  

* Represent 360Player’s technology to investors, partners, and enterprise customers
* Clearly articulate our technical strategy and platform capabilities


 Who You Are
   

  

* Proven senior engineering leader in a SaaS environment (VP Engineering, Director, or CTO)
* Experienced in scaling both teams and systems
* Architecturally strong and technically credible
* Comfortable operating in modern, AI-enabled development environments
* Structured, pragmatic, and business-oriented


 You do not need to code daily, but you must be able to go deep when required and earn the trust of senior engineers.
   

  

 Details
   

  

 Location: Central Stockholm (office-based) Reports to: CEO Start: As soon as possible
   

  

 Compensation: Competitive salary plus a meaningful long-term incentive package including warrants (equity participation).

title: IAM Consultant
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products
* Be a productive member of the team.


 Requirements
   

  

 Support the client in designing and implementing fit-for-purpose IAM (Identity and Access Management) capabilities aligned with previously identified business and technical needs. Key focus areas include:
   

* Securing service-to-service communication within a microservices architecture
* Managing administrative access across the ecosystem
* Enabling secure change management and CI/CD processes from an IAM perspective
* Implementing IAM solutions for customers and partners
* Integrating new authentication methods and leveraging existing ones using modern protocols
* Collaborating with and consuming IAM services on cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform


 Mandatory Requirements (must be clearly reflected in the CV):
   

* Extensive experience and strong technical expertise within the IAM domain
* Broad hands-on experience across the IAM focus areas outlined above
* Solid knowledge of modern IAM standards and protocols, including OpenID Connect, OAuth 2.0, eBPF, and SPIFFE
* Strong experience with the open-source Janssen IAM Platform
* Practical experience with GitHub, Rancher (Kubernetes), Cilium, and PostgreSQL
* Proven ability to define IAM capability requirements, including governance, administrative, and operational procedures
* Several years of hands-on experience in Java development
* Deep expertise in establishing both technical IAM capabilities and administrative lifecycle management processes for identities and access attributes, ensuring proper governance and sustainable platform operations


 Desirable (Value-Added) Qualifications:
   

* Experience supporting organizations in IAM transformation initiatives similar in scope and complexity
* Strong understanding of IAM services offered by leading cloud platforms and experience integrating or coexisting with non-cloud-based IAM solutions


 Benefits
   

  

* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Cloud Engineer med Azure
description:
På Sogeti tror vi att det bästa finns inom oss alla. Oavsett om du är i början av din karriär eller redan på toppen av ditt spel, kommer vi att uppmuntra dig att nå din fulla potential och bli bättre. Genom vår gemensamma passion för teknik, vår entreprenöriella kultur och vårt fokus på kontinuerligt lärande, kommer vi att ge dig allt du behöver för att göra ditt bästa arbete och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Rollen innebär att vara en nyckelspelare i vår digitala transformation och säkerställa att våra lösningar är skalbara, säkra och framtidssäkra.
   

  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*
 Design och implementering av avancerade molnlösningar för våra kunder, ofta i hybridmiljöer.
   

  

 Arkitektur, säkerhet och automatisering av mölntjänster.
   

  

 Rådgivning i molnstrategiska frågor.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Erfarenhet av automatiserade byggpipelines och CI/CD-metoder samt implementering
   

  

 4+ års erfarenhet av Azure-arkitektur och implementation
   

  

 Djup förståelse för molnsäkerhet, nätverk och kostnadsoptimering
   

  

 Certifiering: Azure Solutions Architect  (eller motsvarande)
   

  

 Arbetat med komplexa migreringsprojekt
   

  

 Erfarenhet av automatiserade byggpipelines och CI/CD-metoder samt implementering
   

  

 Talar och skriver svenska flytande
   

  

 Tekniska kunskaper inom: Azure: App Services, Functions, Logic Apps, Azure SQL; IaC: Bicep, Terraform; CI/CD: Azure DevOps
   

  

**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
 Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
   

  

 Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

 Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
   

  

 Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.
   

  

**Ansökan**
*Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Camilla Lindberg på camilla.lindberg@sogeti.se*
*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
 Om Sogeti
   

  

 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 19 kontor och 1200 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: Data Engineer
description:

title: Senior Software Consultant

title: Enterprise Architect – Technology Modernization & Innovation
description:
Are you driven by transforming complex technology landscapes, modernizing platforms at scale, and shaping the architecture of tomorrow? At Sandvik Coromant, we’re looking for an Enterprise Architect to influence our direction in a meaningful and hands‑on way.
   

  

**Why join us in this role**
 This is a chance to shape the digital backbone of a global industry leader and make a visible impact on how we innovate, grow, and operate. You’ll benefit from:
   

  

* A modern hybrid work environment with global exposure.
* Being involved in decisions that directly shape our future and drive our digital transformation.
* The opportunity to steer the organization toward cloud-based, data driven and modular ways of working to accelerate innovation.


**Your mission**
 As Enterprise Architect, you take a leading role in modernizing our technology landscape. You define and guide target architectures, principles and guardrails that enable the organization to adopt modular, cloud‑native, API- and event‑driven patterns where appropriate. You also evaluate emerging technologies (e.g., AI/ML, IoT, modern data and automation platforms) and assess their architectural fit, opportunities, and risks for enterprise‑wide adoption.
   

  

 Working closely with senior leaders, architects and product teams, you shape and execute technology roadmaps, ensuring initiatives align with business needs and target architecture throughout the lifecycle (from idea to implementation readiness). You also lead assessments of tools, platforms and frameworks to determine suitability for enterprise‑level use. By setting standards, guiding architectural decisions and providing architectural guidance to teams, you ensure consistent application of enterprise standards, patterns and best practices.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include:
   

  

* Defining target architectures and architectural patterns that drive adaptability, speed and cost efficiency, and ensuring that solution designs align with business needs and enterprise direction.
* Defining and enforcing technology standards and architectural direction.
* Leading the development of technology roadmaps and guiding pilot evaluations to validate architectural concepts and future capabilities.
* Tracking and communicating measurable business and technical impact.


**Location**
 This position is based in Stockholm or Sandviken, reporting to the Head of Enterprise Architecture. You work in an international hybrid environment with your immediate team located in Sweden.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You combine extensive leadership experience with deep, hands‑on expertise in modern enterprise architecture. You’ve successfully driven large‑scale modernization programs and worked with distributed systems, microservices, and containerized applications. You’re confident in setting standards, making architectural decisions, and mentoring teams. Experience leading technology roadmaps, piloting new tools and bringing innovations into production is essential, along with strong communication and a collaborative mindset.
   

  

 Experience with leading technology platforms, agile ways of working and modern deployment, information management, integration and automation tools is an advantage. You’re skilled at evaluating emerging technologies and turning them into actionable roadmaps, and you can point to measurable improvements resulting from your architectural decisions. Experience developing and upskilling architects and product teams is also meriting.
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 Are you curious to know more about this position? Please contact Emil Ciepielewski, hiring manager, at emil.ciepielewski@sandvik.com
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts (Sweden):
   

  

* Thomas Lilja, Unionen, +46 (0)70-261 04 82
* Tord Engström, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)76 106 62 87
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Lotta Amnebjer Nordqvist
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than March 3, 2026. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0088164.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed, and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com
   

  

*Sandvik Coromant is part of the global industrial engineering group Sandvik and is at the forefront of developing manufacturing tools and machining solutions, with knowledge that drives the industry standards and innovations demanded by the metalworking industry now and in the next industrial era. Collaborations with educational institutions, extensive investment in research and development and strong customer partnership ensure the development of machining technologies that change, lead and drive the future of manufacturing. Sandvik Coromant owns over 1700 patents worldwide, employs around 8000 staff and is represented in more than 150 countries.*

title: Sales Engineer, Sweden
description:
Ready for an opportunity to make a substantial impact with a disruptive tech company while building your pre-sales career? Rubrik, Inc. has an amazing product, a supercharged team and the financial backing of Lightspeed Ventures, Greylock Partners and Khosla Ventures. Bottom line, if you have limitless drive and like to win, we want to talk to you!
   

  

 Rubrik is looking for Sales Engineers to provide technical direction and business guidance to the regional sales team. As a Sales Engineer, you will be accountable for regional revenue goals by driving innovative technical programs and overseeing day-to-day account-level activities. You will be responsible for evangelising, positioning, and architecting the industry's first hyper-converged hybrid cloud data management platform for a mix of enterprise, mid-market, and small business customers throughout your region.
   

  

**About The Position**
* Provides technical leadership and direction to customers and internal staff in the development of fully integrated technology solutions in support of pre-sales activities in the assigned market.
* Assists in the analysis, design and development of fully integrated technology solutions.
* Demonstrates technical leadership and subject matter expertise on Rubrik’s products, distributed architectures, file systems, and competitive storage offerings in the SAN product space.
* Acts as technical expert and consultant to develop and propose solutions that meet the technology and business requirements of assigned customers.
* Makes technical and sales presentations to customer's technical staff and senior management.
* Serves as a trusted technology advisor to customers and serves as an internal resource on technical issues or specific business applications within an assigned market segment.
* Successfully builds relationships with the account team, partners and customers in support of sales team objectives and engages and leverages corporate resources, abilities, budgets and personnel as appropriate.
* Leads technical sales calls
* Qualifies sales opportunities in the terms of customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding.


**About You**
* 5-7 years of sales engineering experience preferably in a software or data center environment.
* Driven – need for success, highly energetic with a strong hands-on, “can do” approach.
* The successful candidate must have a fundamental breadth of technical knowledge in cloud data management, backup and disaster recovery and data analytics.
* Entrepreneurial - willing to go the extra mile, strong work ethic, resourceful, “get it done” attitude
* Strives in moving in a fast-paced environment; including handling multiple calls/demos per day with immediate follow up.
* A high level of business acumen and experience working with Cx0 level personnel, bringing technology solutions to solve business challenges.
* Smart, adaptable and open-minded
* Bachelor’s degree required or equivalent experience


*Rubrik provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability. In addition to federal law requirements, Rubrik complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.*
 Join Us in Securing the World's Data
   

  

 Rubrik (RBRK), the Security and AI Operations Company, leads at the intersection of data protection, cyber resilience, and enterprise AI acceleration. Rubrik Security Cloud delivers complete cyber resilience by securing, monitoring, and recovering data, identities, and workloads across clouds. Rubrik Agent Cloud accelerates trusted AI agent deployments at scale by monitoring and auditing agentic actions, enforcing real-time guardrails, fine-tuning for accuracy and undoing agentic mistakes.
   

  

 Linkedin | X (formerly Twitter) | Instagram | Rubrik.com
   

  

 Inclusion @ Rubrik
   

  

 At Rubrik, we are dedicated to fostering a culture where people from all backgrounds are valued, feel they belong, and believe they can succeed. Our commitment to inclusion is at the heart of our mission to secure the world’s data.
   

  

 Our goal is to hire and promote the best talent, regardless of background. We continually review our hiring practices to ensure fairness and strive to create an environment where every employee has equal access to opportunities for growth and excellence. We believe in empowering everyone to bring their authentic selves to work and achieve their fullest potential.
   

  

 Our inclusion strategy focuses on three core areas of our business and culture:
   

  

* Our Company: We are committed to building a merit-based organization that offers equal access to growth and success for all employees globally. Your potential is limitless here.
* Our Culture: We strive to create an inclusive atmosphere where individuals from all backgrounds feel a strong sense of belonging, can thrive, and do their best work. Your contributions help us innovate and break boundaries.
* Our Communities: We are dedicated to expanding our engagement with the communities we operate in, creating opportunities for underrepresented talent and driving greater innovation for our clients. Your impact extends beyond Rubrik, contributing to safer and stronger communities.


 Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled
   

  

 Rubrik is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
   

  

 Rubrik provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Rubrik complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
   

  

 Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Hello,** 




  





**I hope you are doing good.** 




  





**Position – Senior Data Engineer** 




**Location – Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Experience - 8+ Years** 




**Language - English** 




**Duration - 6 months B2B Contract, It's extendable.** 




  





**Job Description**




 Cloud Data Engineering Design, build, and optimize data pipelines on GCP using BigQuery, Dataflow, Dataproc,cloud funtions, cloud run and Cloud Storage.Implement ETL workflows for batch and streaming data ingestion.Develop scalable data lake and warehouse architectures following best practices.Optimize query performance through partitioning, clustering, compression, and schema design.(Big query, Bigtable , spanner and fire store)Terraform , DBT knowledge is required with hand on experienceData Processing ModelingBuild realtime streaming pipelines using PubSub Dataflow (Apache Beam).Create dimensional models, starsnowflake schemas, and semantic layers. Write efficient SQL and Python for transformations and automation.Looker knowledge (very important)Orchestration AutomationAutomate workflows using Cloud Composer (Airflow).Implement CI/CD pipelines for data deployments using Cloud Build and Terraform integrated in GitHub Manage versioning, testing, and environment configuration.Security GovernanceApply IAM role-based access, service accounts, VPCSC, and encryption policies.Implement data quality checks and governance using Dataplex and validation frameworks.Ensure compliance with GDPR and internal data security standards.(Encryption and decryption concepts and use of CMEK)Operations MonitoringSet up monitoring dashboards and alerts using Cloud Monitoring Logging.Optimize resource usage to ensure costefficient data processing.Troubleshoot pipeline failures, performance bottlenecks, and data integrity issues.Collaboration Stakeholder InteractionPartner with data analysts, ML teams, and product owners to define data needs.Translate business requirements into scalable cloud architecture.Document data flows, standards, lineage, and best practices for crossteam adoption.

title: Data Platform Product Owner
description:
**Data Platform Product Owner**
 Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 DeLaval is now looking for an experience product owner who has genuine interest in Data&AI platform development to join Digital Services Organization.
   

  

 The Digital Services Unit leads DeLaval’s transition to offer cloud-based services to bring unique value to dairy farmers, dealers, partners, and its own organisation. We are on an exciting journey of connecting farms, robots and cows to the cloud. Through data collection in combination with AI/ML, we are creating new and innovative solutions helping the dairy farmers all around the world.
   

  

****Purpose of role and key responsibilities****
 As a Product Owner at DeLaval Digital Services organization, you will be part of our Data Platform team, you will operationalize the vision and data platform strategy, empowering stakeholders with the right data infrastructure at the right time. You will ensure that the data platform evolves in sync with the organization's changing needs, enabling various product teams to share and harness data for insightful decisions. The challenge is multifaceted—balancing technological advancements, data governance, and user needs while keeping an eye on business objectives and strategic direction. The Product Owner helps the adoption of the data platform, actively investigating different data personas and implementing platform capabilities in accordance with use value drops.
   

  

 We are modernizing the DeLaval data platform, transitioning from a centralized to a decentralized (mesh) operating model to enhance agility and scalability. An excellent team has come together to kick off this rare and transformative journey, if you have genuine interest and experience to make a significant impact, this is a unique opportunity to contribute to this groundbreaking initiative.
   

  

**What You'll Do As a Data Platform Product Owner**
* Drive data platform roadmap and lead the sprint demos, retrospectives, and stakeholder interview sessions
* Manage the product backlog and prioritize features based on business value (e.g. User Story Mapping sessions, co-define the DoD with the team,)
* Guide stakeholders and communicate the data team’s strategy, ambitions and priorities
* Champions the platform’s value, actively inspires stakeholders to think differently about how data platform can be used
* Work closely with data engineers, tech lead, analysts, data stewards and business stakeholders to ensure the platform's features meet their requirements
* Establish and monitor the platform’s health metrics
* Sketch proper golden paths for different JTBDs tailored different data personas
* Set up a feedback loop mechanism to enhance the quality of processes
* Prepare for quarterly CoPlanning sessions, collect requirements, pain points and priorities


****Required qualifications and experience:****
 To be successful in this role we see that you have:
   

  

* Proven track record and more than 3 years of experience in a similar role
* Product ownership productivity tools expert (e.g. Jira, Miro, Confluence…)
* Good experience with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)
* Self-motivated, curious with an analytical thinking capacity, metric-oriented to measure the success of the data platform
* Decent cross-functional communications skills, act as the "voice of the customer"
* Familiarity with data management and governance principles (Data catalogue, quality, SLI/SLO, regulations, access management,….)
* Familiarity with Databricks and/or AWS is a big plus
* Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT, and Business Administration
* Professional English, written and spoken skills


****Working at DeLaval****
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours, Set Direction, Make things happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* Market-based salary with an individual incentive program based on performance and company result
* Secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year
* Private health insurance
* Flexible working hours and reduced working hours.
* 30 days paid vacation


 This position is located in Tumba, Sweden. You will report to Data&AI Platform Product Manager.
   

  

****Application****
 To apply for this position, you must send in your application though the DeLaval career page. Careers - DeLaval . Kindly note that we do not accept applications via email. We review applications ongoing so do not wait to apply. Please note that response times may be longer than usual due to holiday periods. We appreciate your patience and understanding.
   

  

****Contact****
 If you have questions regarding the position or the recruitment process, please contact:
   

  

 Hiring manager: Mohammmadreza Babaee, Data&AI Platform Product Manager ( Mohammadreza.babaee@delaval.com )
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, ( agnes.edbom@delaval.com )
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,700 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at www.corporate.delaval.com

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Senior Full stack Engineer – B2B SaaS (New Platform Build)** 




  





 We’re working with a
 **profitable, product-led SaaS company** 
 in the B2B logistics space that is entering a major
 **“2.0” growth phase** 
 . The business has thousands of active customers, strong organic revenue, and long-standing partnerships with major international shipping and freight providers.
 



  





 They are now building a
 **brand-new platform from scratch** 
 , scheduled to launch later this year, and have paused feature development on their existing (already profitable) system to fully focus on the new build. This is a rare opportunity to join an
 **early-stage platform rebuild** 
 within a financially stable, mature company.
 



  





**The Role** 




 We’re looking for
 **hands-on Senior Full stack Engineers** 
 who enjoy building, owning, and scaling real products. You’ll work closely with product, UX, QA, and fellow engineers, taking responsibility across backend services, APIs, and frontend delivery.
 



  





 The product is
 **backend-heavy** 
 , but full stack capability is essential.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 




  




* Playing a key role in designing and building a brand-new SaaS platform
* Developing scalable backend services using
 **TypeScript and Node.js**
* Designing and implementing
 **REST APIs** 
 for core product functionality
* Contributing to frontend development using modern frameworks
* Collaborating in cross-functional product teams
* Writing automated tests to ensure performance, reliability, and maintainability
* Taking part in technical discussions and influencing engineering best practices
* Working in a fast-paced, pragmatic, delivery-focused environment



  





**Product Teams** 




  





 You’ll join one of several product-focused squads, such as:
 


* **Shipment & Carrier Systems** 
 (booking, pricing, carrier integrations)
* **Integrations & Extensions** 
 (e-commerce platforms, ERPs, customer systems)
* **Frontend & User Access**
* **Payments, Pricing & Billing**



  





 Each team is small, autonomous, and ownership-driven.
 



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* ~7+ years professional software development experience
* Strong experience with
 **JavaScript / TypeScript** 
 (5+ years)
* Solid
 **Node.js** 
 experience (Express or similar)
* Experience building and consuming
 **REST APIs**
* Cloud experience (preferably
 **AWS** 
 )
* Experience with at least one modern frontend framework (React, Vue, Angular, Svelte)
* Experience working with
 **SQL and NoSQL** 
 databases



  





**Nice to have:** 



* CI/CD, Docker, Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Pulumi, etc.)
* Experience building scalable, secure systems
* Some DevOps / infrastructure exposure



  





**The Kind of Engineer They Want** 



* Self-starting, high-pace, delivery-focused
* Comfortable taking ownership and making decisions
* Someone who can
 **reduce load on tech leads** 
 , not increase it
* Pragmatic builders who enjoy shipping features and improving systems
* Scale-up / product mindset over corporate bureaucracy



  





 They value
 **impact and pace over years on paper** 
 a strong, driven engineer with ~5–7 years in the right environments will outperform someone with 20 years who needs hand-holding.
 



  





**Location & Working Model** 



* Offices in
 **Stockholm** 
 and
 **Jönköping**
* Hybrid preferred
* Open to remote within Sweden for the right person
* English-speaking environment



  





**Package** 



* Permanent role
* Highly Competitive Salary
* Performance-based bonus (company-revenue dependent)
* Standard pension with employer top-up
* Wellness allowance (~4,000 SEK/year)
* 5 weeks’ vacation (negotiable)



  





**Why This Role?** 



* Very stable company with
 **organic growth**
* Profitable product,
 **not VC-dependent**
* Brand-new platform build with huge technical impact
* High ownership, autonomy, and trust
* Tons of feature development and real engineering challenges

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**🚀 VNTRS växer!** 

  





 Vi söker nu en Senior Data Engineer som brinner för innovation och data.
 



 Vill du vara en del av ett team som använder den senaste tekniken och växer både i Sverige och internationellt?
 



 Har du starka färdigheter inom engineering och analys och vill arbeta med inspirerande människor?
 



 Då kommer du definitivt trivas hos oss på VNTRS!
 



  




 Om VNTRS
 
  





 Att skapa framgångsrika företag tillsammans med våra kunder ligger i hjärtat av VNTRS.
 



 Vi tror att allt för många bra idéer misslyckas av fel anledningar – det vill vi ändra på.
 



 Vi är konsulter, men ser oss inte riktigt som sådana. Vi tror att vi har störst chans till framgång genom att samarbeta långsiktigt med våra kunder och arbeta som ett gemensamt team.
 



 Vi är idag över 30 medarbetare, och på VNTRS gillar vi att dela både risk och uppsida.
 



 Att samarbeta med lovande entreprenörer och företag, och dela både risk och vinster med alla medarbetare, är en av hörnstenarna i VNTRS.
 



  




 Om rollen
 
  





 Som Senior Data Engineer på VNTRS kan du förvänta dig stor variation i dina arbetsuppgifter:
 


* Hands-on data engineering
* Rådgivning till kunder
* Strategiska datalösningar



 Du kommer främst att arbeta nära externa kunder, men även med startups i VNTRS portfölj.
 



 Vi ger dig möjligheten att arbeta med spännande projekt som breddar din kompetens.
 



 Under uppdragen kommer du använda en rad olika data engineering-teknologier och samtidigt vara en central del i tvärfunktionella team.
 



 Beroende på uppdrag kommer din åsikt att ha stor påverkan på lösningar och hela processen, inklusive prioriteringar, tech-stack och arkitektur.
 



  




 Krav för rollen
 * Minst 5 års erfarenhet som Data Engineer / BI Engineer
* Data warehousing, t.ex. Microsoft Azure Synapse, Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift, Snowflake
* Datamodellering & arkitektur
* ETL (Extract, Transform & Load)
* Programmering & scripting, t.ex. Python, SQL, Scala, Java, C#
* API & dataintegration
* Molnlösningar – helst Azure (Data Factory, Synapse Analytics)
* Flytande svenska och engelska
* Pragmatisk, självgående och social



  




 Meriterande
 * Business Intelligence & Data Visualization Tools (t.ex. Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Qlik Sense)
* Big Data Processing (t.ex. Apache Spark, Databricks, Hadoop, Google Dataflow)
* Data Governance & Quality – Data Cataloging, GDPR-compliance, Data Lineage Tools (Collibra, Alation)
* Tidigare erfarenhet från konsultverksamhet
* Kandidatexamen eller masterexamen


 Övrig information
   

**Fantastiskt equity- & bonusprogram** 

 Alla medarbetare får exklusiv rätt att investera i startups i vår portfölj.
   




**Coachande kultur och mandat att förändra** 

 Vi tror på en platt organisation där alla är med och formar VNTRS.
 



 Du får verkligt ansvar från dag ett och tillsammans skapar vi en personlig utvecklingsplan baserad på dina karriärmål.
   




**Roligt och balans mellan arbete och fritid** 

 På VNTRS tror vi på att ha roligt på jobbet och uppmuntrar en hälsosam balans mellan arbete och privatliv med flexibel hybridmodell.
 


* Varannan fredag: social lunch på huset
* Varannan onsdag: frukost på huset
* After-work på kontoret i slutet av veckan
* Två årliga konferenser


**Generösa förmåner** 
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr
* Utbildningsbonus
* Föräldralönepålägg under 6 månader

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - Lylli
description:
At Lylli, we’re on a mission to make reading magical for children everywhere. Our app combines thousands of children’s books with personalized stories, helping families discover new ways to read, learn, and imagine together.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a Senior Fullstack Developer to help us scale our platform, build delightful new features, and bring the joy of reading to millions of families worldwide.
   

  

 We're a sister studio to Toca Boca, located in Östermalm.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Lead the development of end-to-end features, from database design and APIs to frontend interfaces.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other engineers to turn ideas into reality.
* Build scalable backend services (Java Spring Boot, Node.js) and polished frontend experiences (React).
* Ensure performance, security, and reliability across the stack as we scale internationally.
* Play an active role in architectural decisions and product strategy.


 ,
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience as a fullstack engineer, with strong skills in both backend and frontend.
* Solid knowledge of Java and/or Node.js and preferably React.
* Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure), CI/CD pipelines, and scalable system design.
* Strong understanding of relational databases and APIs (Postgres).
* A product-driven mindset – you care about usability, performance, and making the experience magical for the end user.
* Bonus: Experience with mobile development, audio streaming, or content-heavy platforms.


**Who You Are**
* You enjoy taking ownership and thrive in a fast-moving startup environment.
* You’re passionate about clean, maintainable code and engineering excellence.
* You love collaborating across functions and helping teammates grow.
* Most importantly: You want to use your skills to get more kids to love reading.


**What We Offer**
* A central role in shaping one of Europe’s fastest-growing children’s reading platforms.
* The opportunity to influence both product and technical direction.
* A playful, collaborative, and international team.


**Good to know!**
 This position is full time and based in our Stockholm office with a hybrid working model (part office, part working from home). We apply a 6-month probationary period. You’ll need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support relocation.
   

  

 Lylli is a Swedish tech company building the world’s first storytelling platform — reinventing how children experience stories in a digital world. By merging cutting-edge technology with captivating narratives, Lylli transforms reading into an immersive, joyful experience that fosters cognitive growth and inspires a lifelong love of books. In partnership with leading publishers, authors, and creators, Lylli unlocks unlimited access to thousands of titles — from timeless classics like
 *Alfie Atkins* 
 and
 *Peter-No-Tail* 
 to global sensations like
 *Paw Patrol.*

title: Tech Lead - Circular Parts Platform
description:
Join Scania Ventures and New Business
   

  

 Scania Ventures and New Business build new ventures that extend Scania’s role in the transport ecosystem. The Circular Parts Platform is one of these ventures — a digital ecosystem connecting heavy truck workshops and vehicle dismantling companies to enable the reuse of high-quality spare parts through secure, scalable, and data-driven solutions.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Tech Lead to take ownership of the technical direction and product delivery of this venture. You will be part of the core venture leadership team, working closely with the Venture Lead (Managing Director), Venture Business Lead, and Finance Lead.
   

  

 Your Mission
   

  

 As Tech Lead, you are accountable for product delivery, technical integrity, scalability, and reliability of the Circular Parts Platform. You ensure that business and product ambitions are translated into robust, secure, and maintainable solutions.
   

  

 You will work in close partnership with the Venture Growth and Commercial Business Lead to align product priorities with technical feasibility, and with the Venture Finance Lead to ensure cost efficiency, scalability, and compliance. Together with the Venture Lead, you shape the long-term technical strategy of the venture.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Define and own the platform’s technical architecture, standards, and long-term technical roadmap. Collaborate with the Venture Growth and Commercial Business Lead to create and maintain the product roadmap and make feature prioritizations.
   

  

  

* Own the product backlog and lead end-to-end product and technology delivery, from MVP to scalable production platform.
* Ensure the platform meets requirements for security, reliability, performance, and compliance.
* Partner with the Venture Finance Lead on cost structures, scalability considerations, and investment decisions.
* Build and lead a high-performing technical team
* Establish AI-driven and agile ways of working, engineering standards, and quality practices.
* Act as the primary technical representative in internal reviews and external partner discussions.
* As a member of the management team of the venture, shape the venture's overall success actively taking part in decision-making


 Who You Are
   

  

 You are a senior technical leader who combines strong engineering expertise with a pragmatic, product and business-oriented mindset. You thrive in venture environments where clarity must be created, and decisions balance speed, quality, and long-term sustainability.
   

  

**Your Background**
 You bring more than ten years of experience in software engineering, including at least two years in technical leadership roles with end-to-end product delivery responsibility. You have proven experience in architecting and delivering cloud-native, scalable digital platforms, along with a strong understanding of modern architectures, APIs, data platforms, and integrations. You are experienced in leading cross-functional teams in agile environments, and familiarity with marketplace or multi-stakeholder platforms is considered a strong advantage. You are fluent in English, and proficiency in Swedish is an advantage
   

  

**Your Personal Traits**
 You are structured, analytical, and quality-driven, with a strong ability to make sound architectural and delivery trade-offs. You are a collaborative leader who communicates clearly across business and technology domains, combining curiosity and pragmatism with a strong motivation to build sustainable digital solutions. You bring a strong product-thinking mindset and the ability to empathize with customer needs.
   

  

 Why Join Us
   

  

 You will play a key role in building and scaling a new digital venture from the ground up as part of Scania’s innovation ecosystem. As a member of the core leadership team, you will influence product, architecture, and delivery decisions from day one, working closely with a cross‑functional, agile team. You will experience the pace and energy of a start‑up, backed by the scale and stability of a global company, while contributing directly to circularity and sustainability in the transport industry.
   

  

 Location
   

  

 The office is located in central Stockholm.
   

  

 Contact and Application
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application, consisting of your CV and any relevant certificates, and kindly ask you not to share a cover letter to ensure an efficient and unbiased recruitment process for all parties.
   

  

 We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-03-08. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Katarina Stylander, Talent Acquisition Specialist, katarina.stylander@scania.com

title: Agentic AI Solution Specialist (Cloud & Custom Applications)
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra Cloud & Custom applications-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Agentic AI Solution Specialist blir du en drivande kraft i att forma framtidens intelligenta automation. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra kunder för att identifiera affärsmöjligheter och omsätta dem till robusta, agentbaserade AI-lösningar. Rollen är konsultativ och kombinerar tekniskt djup med affärsmässighet – du är både rådgivare och inspiratör. Utöver arbetet med kunder blir också en viktig del av vårt interna kompetensnätverk genom kunskapsdelning, pre-sales och strategiska initiativ. Eftersom rollen är ny får du stor frihet att påverka dess utveckling och forma vägarna framåt för att skapa verkligt värde för Capgemini och våra kunder.
   

  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*
* Driva kundprojekt inom Agentic AI och intelligent automation från idé till leverans.
* Agera senior advisor i strategiska initiativ och projekt som rör Agentic AI, och bidra med expertstöd i komplexa frågor.
* Utveckla och presentera go-to-market-förslag samt delta i pre-salesaktiviteter.
* Bygga och dela kunskap internt genom Capgeminis Guilds och Centers of Excellences, samt kombinera teknisk expertis med affärsdrivande och kommunikativa insatser för att inspirera och sälja in lösningar.


**Din profil**
* Dokumenterad kompetens inom Agentic AI och erfarenhet av att omsätta komplex teknik till affärsvärde.
* Djup teknisk expertis kombinerad med affärsmässighet och en konsultativ, kommunikativ och pedagogisk approach – du kan förklara teknik på ett sätt som skapar förståelse och engagemang.
* Förståelse för att förändringsinitiativ handlar om människor lika mycket som teknik – du skapar engagemang och säkerställer adoption av nya lösningar.
* Flytande kunskaper i engelska och svenska i tal och skrift


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Möjligheten att forma en pionjärroll med stor frihet och påverkan på dess utformning – du blir en nyckelperson i att driva intelligent automation och Agentic AI hos våra kunder och internt.
* Tillgång till den senaste tekniken och plattformar som Microsoft Copilot, Azure AI foundry, UiPath Agentic och Google Cloud, samt ett globalt nätverk av experter.
* En kultur som uppmuntrar innovation, kompetensutveckling och kunskapsdelning, där du får utrymme att leda förändring och skapa verklig impact.


**Ansökan**
*Efter att du skickat in din ansökan gör vi en första urvalsbedömning. Därefter följer en telefonintervju med ansvarig Talent Acquisition Partner, en intervju med rekryterande chef på kontoret och en teknisk intervju där vi går djupare in på din kompetens. Som avslutning genomför vi relevanta tester och referenstagning innan vi går vidare till ett eventuellt erbjudande.*
*Vi värdesätter din tid och ser till att du får tydlig kommunikation och snabb återkoppling genom hela processen. Du kommer löpande kunna ställa frågor och få uppdateringar från ansvarig Talent Acquisition Partner – vårt mål är att skapa en positiv upplevelse där du får en rättvis bild av både rollen och oss som arbetsgivare.*
*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Informationsarkitekt till Ving
description:
**Vi står inför en av våra viktigaste moderniseringssatsningar: att gå från ett traditionellt datalager i Azure Synapse, SSAS och SSRS till en modern, integrerad plattform i Microsoft Fabric och Power BI. För att lyckas söker vi en informationsarkitekt som vill ta en central roll i vårt arbete med information management, data governance och etablering av en ny dataorganisation.**
**Om tjänsten**
 Som informationsarkitekt blir du en nyckelperson i vårt information management-program. Du kommer att:
   

  

  

* Kartlägga och analysera verksamhetens datakällor och analysbehov.
* Designa informationsmodeller, dataflöden och konceptuella lösningar som implementeras av vårt data-team.
* Stegvis förnya och flytta vårt befintliga DW, marts, kuber och rapporter till Fabric-dataset och Power BI.
* Etablera datakatalog, informationsarkitektur och grundläggande data governance.
* Stötta verksamhetsområden i att förstå, strukturera och prioritera sina data- och analysbehov.
* Leda workshops och förankra beslut med verksamhetsledare och produktägare.


 Rollen är placerad i vårt utvecklingsteam för
 **Data & Integration** 
 och rapporterar till Engineering Manager för detta team. Som informationsarkitekt ingår du även i vår
 **Enterprise** 
**Architecture** 
 -gruppering och samarbetar tätt med övriga arkitekter, vilket även ger möjlighet att bidra i vårt övergripande EA-arbete. Genom att etablera Fabric och en hållbar informationsarkitektur lägger vi grunden för mer avancerad analys, AI och data science i framtiden – här blir du en central möjliggörare.
   

  

 Här får du chansen att driva en moderniseringsresa som påverkar hela vår organisation. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team med stor frihet att påverka metodik och arbetssätt, och du får bygga grunden för vår långsiktiga data- och informationshantering.
   

  

**Vem vi söker**
 Du brinner för att skapa ordning i data och har en stark analytisk ådra. Du är van vid att omsätta verksamhetskrav till datamodeller och flöden, och du kommunicerar komplexa samband på ett tydligt sätt.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du uppfyller följande krav:**
* Erfarenhet som informationsarkitekt, data- eller BI-arkitekt.
* God förståelse för informationsmodellering, datakataloger och metadatahantering.
* Erfarenhet av BI-lösningar, gärna Microsoft (Synapse, Power BI, SSAS, SSRS).
* Intresse och nyfikenhet kring Microsoft Fabric och moderna data- och analysplattformar.
* Vana av att arbeta nära både verksamhet och utvecklingsteam.


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av att etablera data governance och dataorganisation.
* Kunskap om dataplattformar i moln, särskilt Azure.
* Förståelse för agila arbetssätt och iterativ modernisering.
* Kunskap om dataanvändning för processoptimering eller prediktiv analys.


**Vår tekniska miljö**
 Vi är 13 utvecklingsteam på IT-avdelningen i Stockholm som tillsammans driver utvecklingen framåt. Våra BI-lösningar står inför en omfattande förflyttning till
 **Microsoft** 
**Fabric** 
 , där informationsarkitekten får en ledande roll. Våra system byggs i en modern Microsoft-miljö och vi arbetar med aktuella tekniker, ramverk och verktyg som .NET Core, C#, Node, Azure, React, React Native, JavaScript, GraphQL, MS-SQL och Redis.
   

  

 I linje med vår cloud-first-strategi satsar vi på skalbara och framtidssäkra lösningar där innovation, prestanda och kvalitet alltid står i fokus.
   

  

 Läs mer om
 **vår IT-avdelning här** 
 🧑‍💻
   

  

**Om NLTG**
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete med andra team och verksamheten för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har ett högt medarbetarengagemang och en härlig kultur. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
   

  

 Läs mer om
 **vad vi erbjuder här** 
 🏄
   

  

****Övrigt****
 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst och placerad på Vings fina huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när det passar för teamet/arbetsuppgiften.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 hakan.sandstrom@nltg.com 070-9513226
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett mer objektivt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Du får mer information när du skickat in din ansökan, men om du är nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer hos Alva Labs .**
**Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en bakgrundskontroll att genomföras.**
**🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet**
**🤝 Tjänstepension**
**🌎 Reseförmåner**
**🦉 Utveckling och lärande**
**💗 Well-being**
**💼 Hybrid arbetsplats**
 Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernenNordic Leisure Travel Group.
   

  

 I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 250 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.

title: Safety Assurance Engineer - 447582
description:
At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 80,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.
  
  

Could you be the full-time Safety Assurance Engineer in Hässleholm we’re looking for?
  
  

Your future role
  
Take on a new challenge and apply your safety assurance expertise in a cutting-edge field. You’ll work alongside knowledgeable, collaborative, and supportive teammates.
  
You'll help shape the future of safe and efficient digital mobility systems. Day-to-day, you’ll work closely with teams across the business (system engineers, hardware and software developers), perform safety analyses, and contribute to the development of safety cases and much more.
  
You’ll specifically take care of supporting safety reviews and addressing findings from internal or external assessors, but also ensure the application of safety assurance methodologies.
  
  

**We’ll look to you for:**  

Delivering and performing safety analyses under the guidance of the Project Safety Assurance Manager (PSAM)
  
Participating in the elaboration of Safety Reports and Safety Cases
  
Applying safety assurance methodologies, including risk acceptance criteria, safety analysis, and verification and validation
  
Attending periodic safety reviews
  
Supporting actions to close findings from internal or external assessors
  
Ensuring strict adherence to the process as per Signalling Safety Instructions
  
  

All about you
  
We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:
  
Advanced University or Engineering degree
  
English proficiency, particularly for reading and writing technical documentation
  
Experience or understanding of safety assurance methodologies or related domains (System, Data Preparation, Hardware, or Software)
  
Knowledge of risk acceptance criteria, verification, and validation processes
  
Familiarity with structured and organized workflows
  
A resilient and rigorous mindset
  
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new challenges
  
  

Things you’ll enjoy
  
Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:
  
Enjoy stability, challenges, and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
  
Work with new security standards for rail signalling
  
Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
  
Contribute to innovative projects
  
Utilise our flexible and inclusive working environment
  
Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
  
Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
  
Progress towards senior safety engineering roles or other leadership opportunities
  
Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, pension)
  
  

You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!
  
  

#LI-DA1
  
Important to note
  
As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.
company_description: Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation.

title: System Integration Engineer
description:
Polar Light Technologies is a fast-growing deep-tech startup developing next-generation photonic and semiconductor technologies to revolutionize the micro-LED industry. We are seeking a highly skilled System Integration Engineer to lead the development and integration of next-generationgeneration microLED display systems. In this role, you will bring together semiconductor devices, optics, electronics, software and advanced manufacturing processes to deliver high-performance microLED display modules. You’ll collaborate across multidisciplinary teams to drive concept development, system architecture, in-house prototyping, customer projects and industrialization of new solutions.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Define and optimize the end-totoend architecture of microLED display systems, including electrical, optical, mechanical, and thermal management
  
Translate performance requirements (brightness, power, color) into system level specifications
  
Drive process integration for chip bonding and alignment
  
Work closely with R&D to improve yield and other performance parameters
  
Collaborate with CMOS backplane designers to ensure signal integrity, current driving accuracy, and display uniformity
  
Conduct circuit level validation and rootlevel validation and rootcausecause analysis of electrical issues
  
Integrate optical components such as microlenses, waveguides, and light managementmanagement films
  
Model thermal performance and implement effective heat spreaderspreader and dissipation strategies.
  
Conduct reliability testing (aging, color shift, thermal cycling) and develop mitigation strategies for device and system levellevel failures.
  
Collaborate closely with semiconductor, optics, materials, mechanical, and manufacturing engineering teams within Polar Light Technologies and our customers
  
Manage technical communication with external suppliers and manufacturing partners
  
Develop prototypes to validate system performance
  
Drive failure analysis and continuous design improvement
  
  

Required Qualifications
  
Master’s or Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Optoelectronics, Physics, Materials Science, or similar
  
3+ years of experience in display technology, LED devices, semiconductor integration
  
  

**Strong knowledge of:**  

LED device physics
  
CMOS backplanes
  
Optics and color science
  
System engineering and root-cause analysis
  
Hands-on experience with optical or electrical characterization equipment.
  
  

Preferred Qualifications
  
Experience with InGaN/GaN-based microLED or MiniLED technologies
  
Familiarity with advanced bonding processes

title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Job Description** **WHAT YOU’LL DO:**

* Lead and deliver complex AI/ML initiatives involving multiple stakeholders, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality, business-critical solutions.
* Architect scalable, enterprise-level solutions by setting the technical direction and ensuring robust, future - proof designs.
* Drive technical excellence and innovation by collaborating across departments, improving engineering practices and integrating emerging technologies and industry trends.
* Identify risks and dependencies as well as creating the alignment needed with dependent teams in order to deliver on committed roadmaps.
* Mentor and develop engineering talent, fostering professional growth, and promoting a strong, collaborative engineering culture.
* Represent and strengthen the Machine Learning Engineering area through active participation in organizational initiatives such as recruitment, onboarding, and strategic collaborations.

 **WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**

You’ll work closely with machine learning engineers, data scientists, data analysts, solution architects, business stakeholders, and engineering managers to build and enhance AI-powered products that drive innovation and efficiency across the supply chain.

  

  

**WHO YOU ARE**

We are looking for people with…


* Proven experience across multiple programming languages, tools and frameworks relevant to AI/ML development.
* Strong expertise in MLOps, including testing, monitoring and proactive incident management to ensure product stability.
* Deep understanding of system architecture, design, performance optimization and security principles for building robust AI/ML solutions.
* Knowledge across data engineering, software engineering and data science to enable effective cross-functional collaboration.
* Ability to break down complex initiatives into actionable steps, clearly communication plans and align teams around execution.


Also preferred if you have:

* Hands-on experience with mathematical optimization techniques (e.g. linear and mixed-integer optimization) and a strong understanding of supply chain processes such as allocation, demand forecasting, and supply planning.


And people who have

* Strong leadership and mentorship skills, with the ability to foster a positive and collaborative environment.
* Ability to drive innovation and continuously improve engineering practices and ways of working.
* Excellent communication skills to engage stakeholders, influence decisions and align work with strategic goals.

The ability to navigate ambiguity and take a structured, step by step approach to achieve meaningful outcomes.  
* 

**WHO WE ARE**

  

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.


We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.  



**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**  



We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

 **JOIN US**

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.


Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.


* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Chief Engineer in Electronics and Software
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **About Volvo Penta**


At Volvo Penta, we combine deep engineering heritage with bold innovation to develop world‑leading marine and industrial solutions. Our culture is built on trust, respect, and individual responsibility. We believe high performance is enabled by collaboration, curiosity, and the courage to challenge conventions — while enjoying our work together.

  

As a global technology leader and pioneer in propulsion, electrification, and software‑defined products, Volvo Penta is now strengthening its technology leadership. We are recruiting a **Chief Engineer Electronics & Software** to play a central role in defining and driving our future technology direction.

 **The Role**


As Chief Engineer Electronics & Software, you will define, own, and govern the long‑term electronics and software architecture for Volvo Penta’s marine and industrial product portfolio. The position carries broad technical responsibility and strategic influence, shaping how electronics and software enable competitive, scalable, and sustainable products over multiple generations.

  

You will operate in an environment characterized by real system complexity, where electronics, software, mechanics, safety, regulation, and user experience must work seamlessly together. The role requires both strategic clarity and hands‑on technical judgement, balancing performance, safety, cost, reuse, and future extensibility.

  

The Chief Engineer is part of the Electronics & Software management team and reports to the Vice President. You will work across technology areas within Volvo Penta, in close collaboration with the wider Volvo Group, and together with partners and suppliers.

 **Electronics & Software – Architecture & Systems Engineering**


The Electronics & Software organization is responsible for the end‑to‑end system architecture of Volvo Penta’s products, covering electronics, embedded software, connectivity, and user interfaces. Our scope spans the full product lifecycle, from advanced engineering and platform definition through industrialization, verification, certification, and long‑term product support.

  

We work across internal combustion, hybrid, electrified, fuel‑cell, and future propulsion technologies, ensuring that architectures are safe, compliant, scalable, and robust across product generations. System decomposition, interface definition, and architectural principles are central to our work, supported by model‑based development, automated verification through SIL and HIL, CI/CD pipelines, and feedback from connected products in operation.

  

A key part of the mission is to lead the transition toward software‑defined, platform‑based products, with increased reuse, automation, and connectivity, while delivering a high‑quality and intuitive customer experience.

 **Responsibilities and Expectations**


In this role, you will lead the definition of the electronics and software architecture strategy and translate it into an anchored, executable roadmap. You will guide major architectural decisions and technical trade‑offs, act as a leading technical authority within Volvo Penta, and support governance of system solutions across projects and platforms.

  

You are expected to work closely with product management, development teams, manufacturing, and external partners, ensuring that technology choices align with customer needs, business objectives, and regulatory requirements. A strong focus is placed on collaboration, knowledge sharing, and leveraging capabilities within Volvo Penta and the broader Volvo Group.

 **Competence Profile**


We are looking for a senior technical leader with deep experience in electronics and software, combined with the ability to operate effectively at system and platform level. You have a strong understanding of complex, safety‑critical, and regulated systems, and a proven ability to shape architecture from early concept through industrialization.

  

You combine a strategic mindset with a pragmatic, hands‑on approach, enabling you to move confidently between long‑term vision and near‑term execution. You are customer‑oriented, able to understand diverse application needs in marine and industrial segments, and capable of balancing competing system attributes into well‑founded solutions.

  

As a leader, you are collaborative and inclusive, comfortable working in flexible constellations across organizational boundaries. You inspire and challenge others with curiosity, courage, and a clear sense of direction, acting as a role model for innovative and lean technology development.

 **Qualifications**


You have a master’s degree in engineering or equivalent experience forming the foundation of your career. You are fluent in English and Swedish, both spoken and written, and have a strong professional track record demonstrating your technical and leadership capabilities.

  

We value diversity and inclusion and strive to build teams with a wide range of experiences and perspectives that strengthen our culture and performance.

 **Contact:**


Maurice Smith, Director PME Electronics and Software, maurice.smith.2@volvo.com

  

Last application date: February 6

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Volvo Penta**, a world-leading supplier of engines and complete drive systems for marine and industrial applications, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who works with passion, trust each other and embraces change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.
